metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9969 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In libwebp 0.5.1, there is a double free bug in libwebpmux.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwebp6 - 0.6.1-2
libwebpdemux2 - 0.6.1-2
libwebpmux3 - 0.6.1-2
webp - 0.6.1-2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: godot package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
libwebp package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.6.1-2').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
qtimageformats-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
